title: Qute bug with string literals and methods
body:
### Describe the bug

I'm trying to obtain a character literal. I've tried the following:

```
{'a'.charAt(0)}
{#let c='a'.charAt(0)}{c}{/let}
{#let c='a'}{c.charAt(0)}{/let}
```

The first one is ignored by the parser. The second one yields an error. Only the third one works. Is this intentional?

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_
